title: FCC Approves Skydance’s Merger With Paramount
summary: The deal, which came under intense scrutiny by the Trump administration, was hailed by the F.C.C. chief, who welcomed “significant changes” at CBS, a unit of Paramount.

title: ‘South Park’ and Other Paramount Shows Skewer Trump After Settlement
summary: “South Park,” Jon Stewart and Stephen Colbert have all been critical of their own company and President Trump this week.

title: CBS News Names Tanya Simon Executive Producer for ’60 Minutes’
summary: Tanya Simon, who has worked on the show for over two decades, will take over at a time of significant change for the network.

title: How a Frantic Scouring of the Epstein Files Consumed the Justice Dept.
summary: There was a single goal in mind: find something — anything — that could be released to the public to satisfy President Trump’s supporters.

title: Trump’s Name Is on Contributor List for Epstein Birthday Book
summary: The Times also reviewed other records of the president’s friendship with Jeffrey Epstein, including an inscription in which the future president called him “the greatest.”

title: The Justice Dept. Interviewed Ghislaine Maxwell, While Opposing Her Appeal
summary: Even as top Justice Department officials brokered an interview with a longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein’s, they asked the Supreme Court to reject her appeal.

title: Powell Tells Trump He Was Wrong About Renovation Costs During Fed Visit
summary: President Trump is used to world leaders bowing down to him, and to cabinet members fawning over him. Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, took a different approach.

title: Convicted Murderer Freed by Trump in Venezuelan Prisoner Swap Is Free in U.S.
summary: At least some American officials knew that Dahud Hanid Ortiz had been convicted of a triple murder when he was put on the plane to the United States.

title: Israel and the U.S. Pull Back From Cease-Fire Talks With Hamas
summary: President Trump’s special envoy said that “we will now consider alternative options to bring the hostages home,” though it was not clear that negotiations had halted.

title: France Will Recognize Palestinian Statehood, Macron Says
summary: The announcement sets France apart from the United States and most of its close allies, and could cause friction with President Trump.

title: Iran Starts New Talks Today Over Its Nuclear Program. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Three European powers will meet with an Iranian minister to try to reopen negotiations over the limits of its nuclear activities.

title: Hulk Hogan, Wrestling Superstar, Is Dead at 71
summary: The charismatic wrestler helped build an entertainment on the margins into a cultural behemoth.

title: Outside the Wrestling Ring, Hulk Hogan Fought Rocky and Endorsed Trump
summary: The muscular entertainer, who died at 71, broke through into pop culture and led the way for Dwayne Johnson and John Cena.

title: Hulk Hogan: A Life in Pictures
summary: The wrestler, who died on Thursday at 71, was the face of the sport as its popularity grew, propelling him into the wider entertainment world.

title: The World Has Too Much Steel, but No One Wants to Stop Making It
summary: A global plunge in prices, led by increased production from China, and U.S. tariffs threaten steel manufacturing, which has long been a symbol of national might.

title: Ken Paxton Claimed Three Houses as His Primary Residence, Records Show
summary: The attorney general of Texas, who is challenging Senator John Cornyn, could have secured favorable mortgage rates, and may have violated the law if he knowingly falsified loan documents.

title: Texas Legislature Special Session: Democrats Attack Silent Republicans
summary: President Trump wants Texas Republicans to redraw the state’s House maps to nab as many as five seats now held by Democrats. But no new maps have been publicly proposed yet.

title: Columbia and Penn Made Trump Deals. More Universities Could Be Next.
summary: Trump officials hope deals with two Ivy League schools create a template that others, including Harvard, Princeton, Brown, Cornell and Northwestern, will follow.

title: Did Columbia’s Deal With Trump Save Its Stature or Sacrifice It?
summary: Reactions ranged from fierce criticism to relief after the university reached a settlement over allegations that it failed to stop the harassment of Jewish students.

title: Alina Habba Is Named Acting U.S. Attorney in New Jersey
summary: Ms. Habba’s tenure as interim U.S. attorney was slated to end this week, but the Trump administration’s appointment will allow her to remain the top law enforcement official in the state.

title: Justice Kagan Urges Supreme Court to Explain Itself in Emergency Decisions
summary: In remarks before judges and lawyers in California, the justice said she believed the court had a responsibility to share its reasoning.

title: Supreme Court, for Now, Pauses Lower Court Decision Limiting Voting Rights Act
summary: The justices paused a lower court order pending a decision on whether the Supreme Court will take up the case, a major challenge to the Voting Rights Act.

title: Chuck Mangione, Jazz Musician Known for ‘Feels So Good,’ Dies at 84
summary: In his signature fedora, he gained wide popularity and 14 Grammy nominations, winning the award twice, while scaling Billboard’s  charts in the 1970s and ’80s.

title: $17 Million Is Lost in A.T.M. Scam That Spread on TikTok, Officials Say
summary: Payment cards for a New York City youth jobs program were used to withdraw millions of dollars over less than three days, officials said.

title: To End the War in Ukraine, Trump Needs Real Negotiations
summary: No one knows what Putin would accept to end his invasion of Ukraine if he were presented with a real negotiation process.

title: At Least 16 People Dead as Thailand’s Clashes With Cambodia Enter Second Day
summary: The conflict along the border is the deadliest between the two nations in 14 years.

title: The Latest Casualty of Social Media Hype Is Your Matcha Supply
summary: The powdered Japanese green tea is increasingly hard to find. Experts say its popularity on the internet is straining Japan’s tea industry.

title: Roy Black, Defense Lawyer for William Kennedy Smith and Epstein, Dies at 80
summary: With a national profile, he represented the notorious and the celebrated, helping to secure an acquittal in the Smith rape case and a lenient plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Lake Tahoe Boaters Died Without Life Jackets, Review Finds
summary: The eight people who died in a June accident were found without flotation devices, according to a new report. The two survivors relied on the devices to stay afloat.
